title: Tsunami mock drill to be held in four districts today
byline: A tsunami mock drill covering the entire island is scheduled to be held today (05) in conjunction with World Tsunami Awareness Day.

title: At least three killed after UPS plane crashes in Kentucky, erupts into ball of fire
byline: At least three people were killed and 11 injured after a UPS wide-body cargo plane crashed in Louisville, Kentucky, erupting into a massive fireball shortly after takeoff, Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear said on Tuesday.

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Northern and Uva provinces and in Trincomalee district after 2.00 p.m., today (05), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Zohran Mamdani elected New York City’s first Muslim Mayor
byline: New Yorkers elected leftist Zohran Mamdani as their next Mayor Tuesday (November 4, 2025) broadcasters projected, on a day of key local ballots across the country offering the first electoral judgement of Donald Trump’s tumultuous second White House term.

title: Four killed in separate road accidents over the past 24 hours
byline: Four individuals, including two youths, have died in four separate road accidents reported from different areas across the island during the past 24 hours, police said.

title: Jaishankar meets Sri Lankan Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa, discusses ties and regional cooperation
byline: Indian External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar on Tuesday met Sri Lankan Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa in New Delhi and reaffirmed India’s commitment to supporting Sri Lanka’s progress and development under its “Neighbourhood First” policy.

title: Typhoon Kalmaegi kills at least 58 in the Philippines, heads toward Vietnam
byline: At least 58 people were dead after Typhoon Kalmaegi left a trail of destruction in the central Philippines and continued to batter parts of Palawan island on Wednesday as it headed toward the South China Sea.

title: Suspicious parcel found washed ashore at Katukurunda Beach
byline: A parcel suspected to contain narcotics has been discovered washed ashore at the Katukurunda Beach, within the Kalutara South Police Division, this morning (05).

title: Submission of Income Tax Returns for the Assessment Year 2024/2025
byline: The Department of Inland Revenue has issued a notice regarding the submission of Income Tax Returns for the assessment year 2024/2025.

title: Suspect arrested with firearm and ‘Ice’ in Mulleriyawa
byline: A suspect has been arrested with a firearm and a quantity of the narcotic substance ‘Ice’ (crystal methamphetamine) in the Sir Baron Jayathilake Mawatha area of Mulleriyawa.

title: Woman murdered by husband following family dispute in Kalmadu
byline: A woman has been murdered by her husband following a family dispute in the Kalmadu area within the Echchankulam police division.

title: Head of UK’s richest family dies aged 85
byline: The head of Britain’s richest family, Gopichand Hinduja, has died aged 85.

title: Suspicious parcel found at Katukurunda Beach contains ‘Hashish’ worth over Rs. 30 mln: Police
byline: It has been revealed that the parcel suspected to contain narcotics, discovered this morning (05) at the Katukurunda Beach within the Kalutara South Police Division, contains a stock of ‘hashish.’

title: More details revealed on Ambalangoda shooting incident
byline: Further information has been revealed regarding the fatal shooting of a businessman in front of the main public library belonging to the Ambalangoda Urban Council yesterday (04) morning.

title: Sri Lanka – UAE joint commission concludes in Colombo
byline: The Second Session of the Joint Commission between Sri Lanka and the United Arab Emirates has been successfully concluded in Colombo.

title: 38kg of cannabis seized in Kalpitiya
byline: A stock of 38kg of cannabis has been seized during a search operation conducted in the Uchchamunai Lagoon in Kalpitiya by the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: Typhoon death toll soars past 90 in the Philippines
byline: The death toll from Typhoon Kalmaegi in the Philippines climbed past 90 on Wednesday as the devastating impact on hard-hit Cebu province became clearer after the worst flooding in recent memory.

title: Over 700 persons arrested in special police raids
byline: A total of 736 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (04).

title: 8th China International Import Expo opens in Shanghai
byline: The latest edition of the China International Import Expo (CIIE), the world’s first national-level exposition dedicated to imports, opened on Wednesday in Shanghai.

title: China bans foreign AI chips from state-funded data centres
byline: The Chinese government has issued guidance requiring new data centre projects that have received any state funds to only use domestically-made artificial intelligence chips, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

title: Miss Universe president slams Thai director for Miss Universe Mexico ‘dumb’ remarks
byline: Raul Rocha, the president of Miss Universe Organization, released a video on Wednesday condemning the actions of Nawat Itsaragrisil, director of Miss Universe Thailand, who was seen reprimanding Miss Universe contestants during a livestream on Tuesday.

title: No Ministry approval to drive wild elephants into forest reserves – Spokesperson
byline: The Ministry of Environment has not granted approval for the on-going campaign launched to drive away wild elephants that have entered villages into forest reserves in Hambantota and Anuradhapura, according to a senior spokesperson of the Ministry.

title: Popular South Indian actor Sarath Kumar arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Popular South Indian film actor Sarath Kumar arrived in Sri Lanka this morning (05).

title: CBSL Governor prepared to appear before Parliament to provide answers
byline: If there are delays in providing answers to questions raised by Members of Parliament regarding Sri Lanka’s economy, Central Bank representatives are prepared to appear before Parliament and provide answers directly, Governor of the Central Bank Nandalal Weerasinghe has stated.

title: India, Nepal lead push for South Asian energy integration
byline: Officials from Nepal and India agreed to enhance cross-border electricity exchange and strengthen transmission infrastructure at the 17th Joint Technical Team meeting in Pokhara, Nepal.

title: Reddit added to Australia’s social media ban on under-16s
byline: Popular forum site Reddit has been added to Australia’s world-first social media ban for children under 16 that starts next month.

title: Primary school principal in Eppawala arrested with over 1kg of heroin
byline: A principal of a primary school in Eppawala, Anuradhapura has been arrested with over a kilogram of heroin, police stated.

title: Train crashes into car at railway crossing between Wanawasala and Kelaniya, one injured
byline: A train has crashed into a car at a railway crossing between Wanawasala and Kelaniya stations.

title: Sri Lanka gears to strengthen copyright law
byline: A committee has been appointed to strengthen copyright law in Sri Lanka.

title: Israeli minister slams New York mayor elect Mamdani as ‘Hamas supporter’
byline: Israel’s diaspora minister on Wednesday slammed New York’s leftist mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani as a “Hamas supporter” and called on the city’s Jews to move to Israel following his victory.

title: Eight arrested for illegal excavation of artifacts in Rideemaliyadda
byline: A total of eight individuals have been arrested for their involvement in the illegal excavations carried out in the Urakote Kanda area of Rideemaliyadda this morning (05), allegedly in search of hidden treasures.

title: Four missing after drowning in Deduru Oya
byline: Four individuals have gone missing this afternoon (05) after bathing in the Deduru Oya, police stated.

title: 10 arrested with narcotics at party organised through Facebook
byline: A total of 10 individuals have been taken into custody along with narcotics during a raid conducted at a party which was organized through Facebook in Gorakana Panadura, police stated.

title: Bodies of four persons drowned in Deduru Oya found
byline: Bodies of four persons who were reported missing after drowning in the Deduru Oya have been found, police stated.

title: Train crashes into car at railway crossing between Wanawasala and Kelaniya
byline: A train crashed into a car at a railway crossing between Wanawasala and Kelaniya stations this evening (05).

title: World Economic Forum chief warns of three possible ‘bubbles’ in global economy
byline: The world should watch out for three possible bubbles in financial markets, including artificial intelligence, the head of the World Economic Forum said on Wednesday, in comments that came amid sharp falls in global technology stocks.

title: Pilot operation to handle large vessels at Colombo’s East Container Terminal begins
byline: Sri Lanka has commenced pilot operations to handle large vessels at the state-owned Colombo East Container Terminal (ECT), a statement from the Department of Government Information noted.

title: Death toll in Deduru Oya tragedy increases to five
byline: A youth, who was rescued after drowning in the Deduru Oya has succumbed while receiving treatment at the hospital, police stated.

title: NPP councilor’s husband arrested with over 1kg of heroin
byline: A principal of a primary school in Eppawala, Anuradhapura has been arrested with over a kilogram of heroin, police stated.

title: Fire breaks out in matchbox factory at Pallekele
byline: A fire has broken out within a matchbox factory at Pallekele in Kandy.

title: NPP Hingurakgoda PS member arrested for obstructing police duties
byline: A Hingurakgoda Pradeshiya Sabha member representing the National People’s Power (NPP) has been arrested for allegedly obstructing duties of police officers.
